course_title: Senior Seminar: Excel for Intermediate Users
class_notes:
Wednesday, 5:30-8:00 pm - GBS 338
*This course will be taught on four dates for 2.5 hours - 
Class Dates:  9/6, 9/13, 9/20, 9/27, alternate date: 10/11 (the alternate date is only used if the instructor or the school has an emergency that causes one of the scheduled dates to be canceled-it will not be held as a makeup date for a missed class)


Seminar Description:  The seminar offers an engaging, hands-on format in which 90% of the class consists of students working in small groups, with frequent breaks to review the solution methodology.    
While useful for consulting/finance jobs, it is also very relevant other career paths:
- Large data set calculations (autofilters, sumifs countifs, vlookup vs. xlookup)
- Pivot tables
- Basic subscription models
- Emphasis on writing re-usable formulas (input cells, anchoring/dollar-tying, trace precedents)  
- Introduction to core keyboard shortcuts and alt-key techniques 
Skill level:
- It is an intermediate class, not advanced
- Students with work experience at an investment bank should not enroll
- Recommended for students who have basic Excel experience and want to improve their skills. 
- The instructor reserves the right to remove students with more advanced expertise or experience.


Instructor:  Sahil Patel is an entrepreneur and current CEO of Spiralyze, a marketing technology company.  Previously, he was the CEO/founder of ER Express, a healthcare software company that he ran for 11 years before selling it in 2021.  He has 23+ years of experience in operations, sales, software development and finance.  He also worked as a consultant for Booz & Company/PWc.  Sahil holds a BBA from Goizueta and an MBA from Harvard Business School.
course_description: Senior seminar courses fall outside the scope of traditional academic coursework, and instead allow students to learn from and interact with experienced practitioners, and to develop industry-specific insights, fine-tune career skills, and increase professional exposure.
prerequisites: This section is reserved for students in the BBA program.
